intro: Plectranthus annuus, commonly known as African violet, is an annual herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It features square stems and opposite leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive velvety texture. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of violet, blue, or white, which bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Plectranthus annuus is popular as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and easy care requirements.
